wikipedia_page.main:
Henry Myerscough (1927 in Islington, London – 2007) was a British violist.
In addition to solo work and teaching, he formed the Fidelio Quartet with his brother, the violinist Clarence Myerscough, and performed for many years as a session musician, including The Beatles' "White" Album and Quatermass.
He played a viola by luthier Gasparo da Salò.

response: *Leo Birnbaum and Henry Myerscough – viola on "Martha My Dear"

He later formed the Fidelio Quartet together with his brother, the violist Henry Myerscough, and was known as much for his chamber music performances and recordings as for solo work. He frequently performed works by Niccolò Paganini, whose birthday he shared.

link_mentions.page: List of people who performed on Beatles recordings
response: *Henry Myerscough—violist; session musician. Contributed viola to "Martha My Dear"
